Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Jack Schmulowitz Manuscript on Julius and Lilly Schmulewitz
Schmulowitz, Jack
Schmulowitz, Jack
WAG.287
0.25 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box.
1999 Materials are in English Julius Schmulewitz (1895-1966) was a member of the Bakery and Confectionary Workers International Union, Local 3. This collection contains a small biographical manuscript on Julius and Lilly Schmulewitz, written by their son Jack Schmulowitz.
Historical/Biographical Note
Julius Schmulewitz (1895-1966) was a member of the Bakery and Confectionary Workers International Union, Local 3. Julius, and his wife Lilly Schmulewitz (1902-1968) immigrated from Poland during the 1920s. Their son, Jack Schmulowitz, wrote this biographical manuscript about their lives in 1999.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains a small manuscript on Julius and Lilly Schmulewitz. The manuscript covers the lives of Julius and Lilly, and Julius's work with the Bakery and Confectionary Workers International Union, Local 3. The manuscript also contains several maps and tables.
Arrangement
The collection is arranged in a single folder.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Jack Schmulowitz in 1999. The accession number 1999.020 is associated with this gift.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Jack Schmulowitz was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Jack Schmulowitz Manuscript on Julius and Lilly Schmulewitz; WAG 287; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
